You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Assign Permissions for Storefront Guest Users

An Experience Cloud site automatically creates a profile that's applied to a user who visits the site but hasn't logged in to an account. B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides a default permission set that provides a starting point for restricting guest user access to your org's data. To help keep your storefront secure against unauthorized access, verify some settings on the guest user profile and apply the appropriate permissions.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To clone a permission set:	Manage Profiles and Permission Sets
To assign a permission set to users:	Assign Permission Sets
To create, customize, or publish an Experience Cloud site:	

Create and Set Up Experiences

AND

View Setup and Configuration

Clone the default B2B Commerce Guest permission set.
NOTE You can modify a cloned permission set so that you can fine-tune permissions for your specific organization. You can't modify the default permission set that the managed package installs.
From Setup, enter Permission in the Quick Find box, and then select Permission Sets.
Find the B2B Commerce Guest permission set, and click Clone in the Action column.
Enter a unique Label, such as B2B Commerce Guest Clone, and a unique API Name.
Save your changes.
Return to the site's Administration workspace.
From Setup, enter Sites in the Quick Find box, and then select All Sites under Digital Experiences.
Click Workspaces next to your site, and then click the Administration workspace tile.
In the Administration workspace, select Pages (1) from the Administration menu and click Go to Force.com (2).
In the site details, click Public Access Settings.

The profile that the site automatically created for your guest users displays. By default, the guest user profile is named Site Name Profile, such as B2B Storefront Demo Profile.

Verify that the View All Users permission is removed from the site's guest user profile.
IMPORTANT The View All Users permission is removed from all orgs with the Salesforce Winter ’21 release. If you complete these steps and notice that the permission remains available in your org, make sure that the permission is disabled.
NOTE This step helps you resolve the security alert, View All Users and Other Permissions Disabled in Guest User Profiles. This security alert is automatically enabled with the Salesforce Summer ’20 release and becomes mandatory with the Salesforce Winter ’21 release.
On the guest user profile page, click Edit.
Scroll to the Administrative Permissions section, and verify that View All Users is removed. If View All Users remains available, make sure that it's disabled and save your changes.
Assign the cloned permission set that you created in step 1 to the site guest user profile.
On the guest user profile detail page, click View Users.
Click the Site Guest User name in the Full Name column.
On the User page, scroll to the Permission Set Assignments section and click Edit Assignments.
Add the clone of the default B2B Commerce Guest permission set to the list of Enabled Permission Sets.
Click Save.
Complete the Remove View All Users Permission from Guest User Profiles security alert.
From Setup, enter Security Alerts in the Quick Find box, and then select Security Alerts.
Find the Remove View All Users Permission from Guest User Profiles security alert, and click Get Started.
For the step named Disable the View All Users Permission on All Guest User Profiles, click Mark as complete. You satisfied this requirement by completing the steps in this topic.
For the step named Grant Guest User Visibility for Specific Use Cases, no action is required. Your storefront doesn't allow guest users to see other members of the site. Click Mark as complete.
For the step named Review Alert, click Done.
SEE ALSO
